meanings.definition: To require or constrain by law, conscience, or force.
meanings.sent1: The school obliges students to wear uniforms.
meanings.sent2: The law obliges citizens to pay taxes.
meanings.sent3: It obliges us to follow the rules, even when we don't want to.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain obliges everyone to stay indoors.
meanings.sent5: The sign clearly obliges drivers to stop at the intersection.

meanings.definition: To do a favor or service for.
meanings.sent1: She obliges her friend by helping with homework.
meanings.sent2: He obliges his neighbor by mowing the lawn.
meanings.sent3: The cat obliges its owner by catching mice in the house.
meanings.sent4: The kind gesture obliges everyone at the party.
meanings.sent5: The waiter obliges the customer by refilling their drink without being asked.

meanings.sent1: Her generosity obliges us to return the favor.
meanings.sent2: Their hospitality obliges us to thank them sincerely.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected gift obliges me to reciprocate.
meanings.sent4: His selfless act obliges us to appreciate the little things.
meanings.sent5: The kind words obliges her to smile in return.
